answers.author: Jim Mack
answers.text:
The City of Mesa IT PMO currently uses Project Server 2007, with Project Professional 2007 clients for Project Managers. Project Resources use the Project Web Access interface to report progress against tasks.
Hoping to move to Project Server 2010 in the near future to leverage improvements in the interface and full SharePoint functionality. Our current installation relies on the free WSS capabilities rather than full SharePoint.
We are keeping an eye on the SaaS market to see what develops. So far, many of the products available in the cloud look to have value for bringing a central reporting platform to organizations that don't currently have one.

Depending on your needs, webbased and managed by subscription or purchase and locally managed. Here are three that I have used and had good luck with. The learning curves were all different.
CMDTS by PSOMAS = cmdts.com, Jeff Gillis
IPM by Sharpsoft = sharpsoft.com, Derek Zalme
Buzzsaw by Autodesk = autodesk.com, no contact.
